results.title: Mao: long march to power
results.creator_credit: Don Thompson, Sam Summerlin, Pat Ferns, New York Times Productions and Nielsen-Ferns
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Leaders of the twentieth century: portraits of power”.
First in a two part film on Mao Tse-tung. His beginnings as a peasant farmer through to his rise to power in the 1949 revolution are highlighted in this film. Attention is also given to Sun Yat Sen’s nationalists: Chiang Kai-shek and Mao’s Communist Party of 1921. Narrated by Henry Fonda. Suitable for upper secondary levels.

results.title: Kip and David. Episode 08
results.creator_credit: Corinne Cantrill, Arthur Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Kip and David”.
It is David’s birthday and Kip is the first to greet him, playing ‘Happy Birthday’ on his pipes. David is given a small microscope and some boxes of prepared slides. They look at some of these and then find things in the garden to inspect under the microscope. The postman brings another parcel, which contains an irrepressible Jack-in-the-Box. Music by Nancy Tow. Narrated by Roy Dunlop.

results.title: Dodging with Chuck O'Connell
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lacrosse - the Fastest Game on Two Feet”.
An instructional film for student players, demonstrating the technique of dodging in lacrosse. With coach Chuck O’Donnell.

results.creator_credit: N.E. Sweglar and Visual Information Systems
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lacrosse - the Fastest Game on Two Feet”.
One of a series of films which demonstrates the skills and techniques of Lacrosse. This film looks at the techniques of scooping the ball, and shows scooping drills.

results.title: Kip and David. Episode 07
results.creator_credit: Corinne Cantrill, Arthur Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Kip and David”.
Violent windy weather prevents Kip a David from playing in the garden. After the gale they survey the damage and cut away a fallen banana palm. They find a young injured bird and care for it until it is strong enough to fly away. They also encounter a giant stick insect on a grapefruit tree. Music by Nancy Tow. Narrated by Roy Dunlop.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Corinne Cantrill, Arthur Cantrill and Firebird Films

results.title: Throwing and catching
results.creator_credit: N.E. Sweglar and Visual Information Systems
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lacrosse - the Fastest Game on Two Feet”
A coaching film concentrating on how one holds the lacrosse stick and the correct way to throw and catch the ball. Also shows exercises to help you and your team develop your skills.
